On 26 May 2016, Linda rushes to the hospital with Christian after she finds out Jane has been brutally attacked by her adopted son <a href="Bobby%20Beale%20%28EastEnders%29">Bobby Beale</a> (Eliot Carrington) and left in a coma. Upon arrival, they speak to the consultants and learn that Jane may never walk again. Linda furiously demands that Ian leaves, to stay away from Jane, and also brands Bobby as evil and a victim of woeful parenting. However, after Ian explains the circumstances to Christian, and Christian speaks to Linda, Linda tells Ian that if he goes home for rest, she will inform him of any news. Linda is horrified to learn that <a href="Steven%20Beale">Steven Beale</a> (<a href="Aaron%20Sidwell">Aaron Sidwell</a>) has returned. Steven once shot Jane in the stomach which is the reason for Jane not being able to have children of her own. Once Jane awakes, she tells her about Steven. Linda returns to the Square briefly where she meets <a href="Linda%20Carter">Linda Carter</a> (<a href="Kellie%20Bright">Kellie Bright</a>) and <a href="Masood%20Ahmed">Masood Ahmed</a> (<a href="Nitin%20Ganatra">Nitin Ganatra</a>). She tells Masood how she wishes Jane would have stayed with him. After saying goodbye to Jane, Linda returns to <a href="Orlando">Orlando</a> Florida.
Evie Brown.
Evie Brown, played by <a href="Marji%20Campi">Marji Campi</a>, is the ex-wife of <a href="%23Bert%20Atkinson">Bert Atkinson</a> (<a href="Dave%20Hill%20%28actor%29">Dave Hill</a>). She makes her first appearance when Bert visits her in a hospice, where she is dying of breast cancer. She tells Bert she still loves him, even though she left him 38 years ago, while he was in prison. She also reveals that her and Bert's daughter had died in 2004, also of breast cancer, and that they have a grandson named <a href="Jay%20Brown">Jay</a> (<a href="Jamie%20Borthwick">Jamie Borthwick</a>). Bert and <a href="Pat%20Butcher">Pat Evans</a> (<a href="Pam%20St.%20Clement">Pam St. Clement</a>) take her to live temporarily with them in <a href="Albert%20Square">Albert Square</a>. Whilst there, Evie and Bert share a kiss, and she then tells Bert that she wants him to make contact with Jay, and that neither Jay nor Karen knew Bert existed, as she brought Karen up to believe her second husband, George, was Karen's real father. Evie dies in the front room of 31 Albert Square whilst talking to Bert and holding his hand. Bert sits with her for two hours until Pat realises she has died. Her funeral takes place on 14 December.
Shirley Carter.
Shirley Carter, played by <a href="Linda%20Henry">Linda Henry</a>, is the estranged mother of <a href="Deano%20Wicks">Deano</a> (<a href="Matt%20Di%20Angelo">Matt Di Angelo</a>) and <a href="Carly%20Wicks">Carly Wicks</a> (<a href="Kellie%20Shirley">Kellie Shirley</a>), and the ex-wife of <a href="Kevin%20Wicks">Kevin Wicks</a> (<a href="Phil%20Daniels">Phil Daniels</a>). After seeing her children again during a holiday in <a href="Devon">Devon</a>, Shirley moves to <a href="Walford">Walford</a> to be near them. After a relationship with <a href="Vinnie%20Monks">Vinnie Monks</a> (<a href="Bobby%20Davro">Bobby Davro</a>), Shirley begins a relationship with <a href="Phil%20Mitchell">Phil Mitchell</a> (<a href="Steve%20McFadden">Steve McFadden</a>). Shirley and Phil buy a house on the Square, and she acts as a mother figure to his son <a href="Ben%20Mitchell%20%28EastEnders%29">Ben Mitchell</a> (Joshua Pascoe) and ward <a href="Jay%20Brown">Jay Brown</a> (<a href="Jamie%20Borthwick">Jamie Borthwick</a>). However, when Shirley discovers that Phil has concealed the truth about Ben killing her best friend <a href="Heather%20Trott">Heather Trott</a> (<a href="Cheryl%20Fergison">Cheryl Fergison</a>), she ends her relationship with Phil.
Lydia Asler.
Lydia Asler, played by <a href="Amy%20Noble">Amy Noble</a>, works for the PR firm employed by Eichel Investment Banking to organise their Christmas party. She works alongside <a href="Bradley%20Branning">Bradley Branning</a> (<a href="Charlie%20Clements">Charlie Clements</a>), who represents Eichel, and her colleague, <a href="%23Rhys">Rhys</a> (Joe Fredericks). She defends Bradley when Rhys bullies him, and invites him out for a drink.
She attends the Christmas party, and insults <a href="Stacey%20Slater">Stacey Slater</a> (<a href="Lacey%20Turner">Lacey Turner</a>), Bradley's girlfriend. This later results in Stacey ruining the party and throwing a drink in Lydia's face. After this, Bradley breaks up with Stacey, and starts a relationship with Lydia. Bradley later grows bored of Lydia and realises he still loves Stacey. He breaks up with Lydia during a <a href="Valentine%27s%20Day">Valentine's Day</a> dinner. This is her last appearance.
Jay Brown.
James "Jay" Brown, played by <a href="Jamie%20Borthwick">Jamie Borthwick</a>, is the grandson of <a href="Bert%20Atkinson">Bert Atkinson</a> (<a href="Dave%20Hill%20%28actor%29">Dave Hill</a>) and <a href="%23Evie%20Brown">Evie Brown</a> (<a href="Marji%20Campi">Marji Campi</a>). Jay first appears after Evie's funeral, when he is taken to live with Bert in <a href="Walford">Walford</a>. Jay's father, <a href="Jase%20Dyer">Jase Dyer</a> (<a href="Stephen%20Lord">Stephen Lord</a>) moves to <a href="Walford">Walford</a> to be with Jay in July 2007, and Bert soon leaves. However, after Jase is killed in disturbance with his old <a href="football%20firm">football firm</a>, Jay lives with <a href="Billy%20Mitchell%20%28EastEnders%29">Billy Mitchell</a> (<a href="Perry%20Fenwick">Perry Fenwick</a>) and starts a relationship with <a href="Abi%20Branning">Abi Branning</a> (<a href="Lorna%20Fitzgerald">Lorna Fitzgerald</a>). After he witnesses <a href="Ben%20Mitchell%20%28EastEnders%29">Ben Mitchell</a> (Joshua Pascoe) killing <a href="Heather%20Trott">Heather Trott</a> (<a href="Cheryl%20Fergison">Cheryl Fergison</a>), he is forced to keep quiet by Ben and his father, <a href="Phil%20Mitchell">Phil</a> (<a href="Steve%20McFadden">Steve McFadden</a>). However, once truth is revealed, Ben is found guilty of murder, and Jay is found guilty of <a href="perverting%20the%20course%20of%20justice">perverting the course of justice</a>.
